intro: Lappula echinata var. grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered lappula, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Chenopodiaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and distinctive, spiny fruits that resemble small, inflated balloons. The plant produces yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often blooming in late summer. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia and is often found in dry, disturbed soils. The leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its adaptability in arid environments.
